class.name: PIXI.WebGLRenderer

parameters.name: [width=0]
parameters.help: the width of the canvas view

parameters.name: [height=0]
parameters.help: the height of the canvas view

parameters.name: [options.view]
parameters.help: the canvas to use as a view, optional

parameters.name: [options.transparent=false]
parameters.help: If the render view is transparent, default false

parameters.name: [options.antialias=false]
parameters.help: sets antialias (only applicable in chrome at the moment)

parameters.name: [options.preserveDrawingBuffer=false]
parameters.help: enables drawing buffer preservation, enable this if you need to call toDataUrl on the webgl context

parameters.name: [options.resolution=1]
parameters.help: the resolution of the renderer retina would be 2

class.help:
The WebGLRenderer draws the stage and all its content onto a webGL enabled canvas. This renderer
should be used for browsers that support webGL. This Render works by automatically managing webGLBatchs.
So no need for Sprite Batches or Sprite Clouds.
Don't forget to add the view to your DOM or you will not see anything :)

public.name: destroy
public.help: Removes everything from the renderer (event listeners, spritebatch, etc...)

public.name: mapBlendModes
public.help: Maps Pixi blend modes to WebGL blend modes.

public.name: render
public.help: Renders the stage to its webGL view

parameters.name: stage
parameters.help: the Stage element to be rendered

public.name: renderDisplayObject
public.help: Renders a Display Object.

public.name: resize
public.help: Resizes the webGL view to the specified width and height.

parameters.name: width
parameters.help: the new width of the webGL view

parameters.name: height
parameters.help: the new height of the webGL view

public.name: updateTexture
public.help: Updates and Creates a WebGL texture for the renderers context.

public.name: blendModeManager
public.help: Manages the blendModes

public.name: clearBeforeRender
public.help:
This sets if the WebGLRenderer will clear the context texture or not before the new render pass. If true:
If the Stage is NOT transparent, Pixi will clear to alpha (0, 0, 0, 0).
If the Stage is transparent, Pixi will clear to the target Stage's background color.
Disable this by setting this to false. For example: if your game has a canvas filling background image, you often don't need this set.

public.name: filterManager
public.help: Manages the filters

public.name: height
public.help: The height of the canvas view

public.name: maskManager
public.help: Manages the masks using the stencil buffer

public.name: preserveDrawingBuffer
public.help: The value of the preserveDrawingBuffer flag affects whether or not the contents of the stencil buffer is retained after rendering.

public.name: renderSession
public.help: TODO remove

public.name: resolution
public.help: The resolution of the renderer

public.name: shaderManager
public.help: Deals with managing the shader programs and their attribs

public.name: spriteBatch
public.help: Manages the rendering of sprites

public.name: stencilManager
public.help: Manages the stencil buffer

public.name: transparent
public.help: Whether the render view is transparent

public.name: view
public.help: The canvas element that everything is drawn to

public.name: width
public.help: The width of the canvas view
